title: Integration Studio—Salesforce Slack integration
content:
You can integrate Service Management with Slack through the Integration Studio. This integration allows your agent users to collaborate in Slack while following the governance processes you have put in place.

Use case

You can use the Slack integration to send messages to Slack to handle, for example, a Major Incident use case.

The integration notifies the key stakeholders in Slack immediately when a major incident occurs, to directly connect the right people. By viewing information about the incident that occurred, the users can collaborate on its resolution.

Example of the message:


In addition, a comment is added to the record where the integration was triggered.

The integration use cases described in this document serve as examples to inspire and guide your integration efforts. However, they should not be considered as prescriptive or guaranteed solutions for your particular scenario. The examples may or may not be applicable for your license edition.


Complete prerequisite tasks in Slack

To integrate with Slack, you must generate an authentication token and create a channel where the Slack integration can post messages.

Generate token

To generate the token used by the Integration Studio to call Slack APIs, perform the following steps:

  1. Log in to the Slack Platform.

    Note: You can perform this procedure as a Workspace Admin or a Regular Member. The only difference is that a Regular Member needs to use the Request to Install functionality to submit a request, and the user can install a Slack app only after the admin approves the request.
  2. Create an app.
  3. Select the OAuth & Permissions tab, and then add this User OAuth Scope: chat:write.
  4. (If you log in as a Regular Member) Click Request to Install on the Install App tab to send a request to the workspace admin. An admin must approve this request for you to install the App in the next step.
  5. Click Install to Workspace on the Install App tab, and then click Allow on the following screen to consent to the permissions added earlier.
  6. Select the OAuth & Permissions tab, and then copy the generated User OAuth Token. You will need to enter this token during the endpoint configuration for the integration.

For details, see the Slack documentation.

Create channel

You need to create a channel where the Slack integration posts messages. See this Slack documentation: Create a channel.

After creating the channel, open the channel details page and copy the channel Id. You need to enter the Id when configuring the integration scenario.​​​​​​

Set up the integration

Perform the following steps to set up the Slack integration.

Prepare an integration user

Perform the following steps to prepare an integration user:

  1. Create an integration user. See How to create an integration user.

  2. Log in to the Agent Portal of SMAX as the tenant admin, navigate to Administration > Master Data > People, locate the integration user, and then assign the proper role to grant access to the required modules. Example: Incident Manager, Incident Analyst, and Incident Coordinator.

    Alternatively, assign the Tenant Admin role to grant general access.

Configure an endpoint

To connect to Slack, you need to configure an endpoint.

Go to Administration > Integration > Endpoints and configure a “Rest Executor 2.0” endpoint.

Enter the following details.

ParameterValue
AgentAgentless
Authentication typeBearer Token
Protocolhttps
Base URLhttps://slack.com/api
TokenThe User OAuth Token generated in Slack. See the prerequisite section for details.
Certificate typeX.509
Certificate formatPEM
Server certificateThe certificate content from Slack

Create an Integration

Create an integration and configure a scenario to define the business logic for sending major incidents to a Slack channel.

In the following steps, you'll create an integration with the predefined template.

  1. Navigate to Administration > Integration > Integration Studio.
  2. Click New, enter the name of your integration, and then click Save. The system displays the Integration page.
  3. In the Details section, configure the integration user you created for the current Service Management system and activate the integration.
  4. In the Connector-Endpoint mappings section, click Add to add a mapping.
  5. Select Generic (under Other) as the connector, select the Slack endpoint that you created earlier, and then enter an alias for the mapping.
  6. Click Save.

Configure the scenario

Perform the following steps to add the scenario to the integration:

  1. Click Add scenario.
  2. Enter a name for the scenario. For example, enter Post message to Slack.
  3. In the Template field, select Slack - Post message into channel (under Other Generic) from the list.
  4. Click Save to add the scenario.
Note: Using templates will make the integration configuration easier than starting from scratch. If you don't select this option, you'll have to manually add your own logic, starting from a blank page.

When using the template, you must configure the following parameters in the Settings rule at the start of the process logic section:

  • SlackChannelId: Enter the Id of the Slack channel you added.

  • UserIdIntegrationUser: Enter the Id of the SMAX user whose name is displayed as the submitter of the comment added to Incident records.

Understand the scenario

The following describes the logic of the scenario rules so that you can customize the scenario as needed.

  1. Sets the parameters as described in the previous section.
  2. Gets the incident details from the SMAX record.
  3. Prepares the data to be included in the payload sent to Slack.
  4. Posts a message to the specified Slack channel.
  5. Adds a comment in the incident record to indicate whether the message was successfully sent.

The Test data rule (disabled by default) can be used to simulate the data passed from SMAX (You need to enter a valid incident Id for the entityId parameter). When you customize and test the integration, you can enable this rule to use the Run scenario button to trigger the scenario with real data. This simplifies scenario testing since the business rule in Studio is not required. Do not forget to disable the rule when you are done with the customization and testing.

Configure business rule to trigger the integration

Finally, create a Business Rule in the Service Management Studio to trigger the integration from an Incident.

Go to Studio, select the Incident record type, and add a Business Rule of type “Call Integration Studio” to the "After applying changes" section. Add the following condition and select Slack integration and scenario.

Example:

The condition in this example is:

${entity.MajorIncident==true && current_update.MajorIncident.IsChanged}

This means when an incident's Major incident option is selected, the system triggers the Slack integration, and sends messages to the configured Slack channel.
